definition: to take a curtain call/(fig.) to come to an end
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline
surname Xie
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
old variant of 幕[mu4]/curtain/screen

sentences.english: A song is played back, the flower curtain.
sentences.chinese: 皆奏一枫曲，次年回首花谢幕。

sentences.english: She didn't return for a curtain call.
They called the actor before the curtain.
sentences.chinese: 他们鼓掌要求这位演员出来谢幕。

sentences.english: Can not take a curtain call and end the suffering of my game .
sentences.chinese: 可谢幕并没有结束这场折磨我的游戏。

sentences.english: This is the final curtain call.
sentences.chinese: 就这样，这次真的是最后的谢幕了。

sentences.english: The audience called for the actor.
sentences.chinese: 观众要求这位演员出来谢幕。

sentences.english: I gave you love, all you gave me was pretend, so now take a bow.
sentences.chinese: 我给了你爱，你给我的全是虚假，所以就谢幕吧。

sentences.english: The curtain fell on the Guangzhou Asian Games with a festive closing ceremony Saturday night on the Haixinsha Island.
sentences.chinese: 27日晚，广州亚运会在海心沙完美谢幕。

sentences.english: The conductor had the soloists take a bow.
sentences.chinese: 指挥请独奏者上前谢幕。

sentences.english: For the old world, it’s game over.
sentences.chinese: 对于旧世界而言，它的舞台已经谢幕。

sentences.english: After the play the actors and actresses took five curtain calls.
sentences.chinese: 剧终后演员们谢幕达五次之多。

sentences.english: The singer was called back three times.
sentences.chinese: 那个歌手被喝采声叫到幕前谢幕三次。

sentences.english: The talk was instead of sadness at seeing an American firm falling to outsiders.
sentences.chinese: 他们表达的是对一个美国公司谢幕的悲伤。

sentences.english: People clapped and shouted and made her come on again and again.
sentences.chinese: 人们鼓掌欢呼，使她一再上台谢幕。

sentences.english: At the end of the show, he locked the frocks and wigs away.
sentences.chinese: 秀场一谢幕，他就将礼服和假发都收拾上锁。

sentences.english: Thank you , then take a bow.

definition: the curtain drops/the end of the show
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to leave/to bid farewell to/to say good-bye to
to elapse/to pass away/to die/demise
The End (appearing at the end of a movie etc)
(of a theater) to empty/(of a show) to end
period (punctuation)/(fig.) endpoint/finish
stage/arena/fig. in the limelight
thunderous applause (idiom)
to leave/to exit
solo dance
to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
full stop/period (punct.)
to salute/to pay one's respects to/to pay tribute to/to pay homage to
to farewell
legendary/fantasy saga/romance/short stories of the Tang and Song Dynasty
